root.message: The SOURCE_TYPE field for indicator 2-2-2b, translated into en
root.data: For the majority of countries, nationally representative household surveys constitute the data source. For a limited number of countries data from surveillance systems is used if sufficient population coverage is documented (about 80%). For both data sources, the child’s length/height and weight measurements have to be collected following recommended standard measuring techniques (WHO/UNICEF 2019).
